talk0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad>...<sp:0:4:0>Sav'otta...<sp:5:0:0> What do you need from me this
early in the morning?
talk0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What do you need?<sp:5:0:0> Are you looking
for someone?
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I finally have the peace of mind to be able
to relax and get a good night's sleep.
Please, let me sleep just a bit longer...
talk0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>I hear you took part in the effort to
repel those Gibdo things that were
attacking the town.<sp:5:0:0> Sarqso...
But it's not over yet, is it?
talk0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:TalkPositive_01>Ah, at last we can finally see the sky
again. I'm not going to miss the sand
shroud one bit.
I've heard all there is to hear about
what happened. You were involved,
weren't you?
The chief must've foreseen what was
going to happen early on. That would
explain why she invited you here.
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_00>She was only a vehvi when I was in charge
of protecting her predecessor.

But sometime between then and now, she
grew into the best vai among all of us.

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>It looks like maybe, <sp:5:0:0>just maybe, <sp:5:0:0>this old
soldier might just be able to finally relax...
talk0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hey. Don't even think about looking down
on our noble guards, understand?

Not only have they adapted to a
<clr:0000>brand-new training regimen<clr:ffff>â€”one
focused on mobility...
but they dove straight into battle without
hesitation against the <clr:0000>Gibdos<clr:ffff>. <sp:5:0:0>They have
nothing if not their pride.
talk0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There's been talk of the new training
regimen getting started again once the
sand shroud clears up.
I need to come up with something to help
revitalize our noble guards...
talk0018:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I've only heard about it secondhand,
but the guards have been training hard
to improve their desert mobility.
You see, <sp:5:0:0>some time ago,<sp:5:0:0> right when <clr:0000>Lady
Riju<clr:ffff> had become chief...

Gerudo Town faced a major crisis.


After it was resolved, <clr:0000>Lady Riju<clr:ffff> swore that
our military forces would be prepared to
face any new threats that came along.
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Think_00>Unfortunately, that was a tougher task
than anyone thought.<sp:5:1:0> Luckily, <clr:0000>Lady Riju<clr:ffff>'s
close friend Princess Zelda came to visit.
The princess suggested that the Gerudo
learn to be more in touch with the
desert itself.
This inspired <clr:0000>Lady Riju<clr:ffff>, and she proposed
a new training regimen. At least, that's
what I heard.
talk0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I don't want to see any more injured
people in need of care. <sp:5:1:0>That includes
you, so be careful.
talk0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ugh, they are so loud. What could Pokki
be refusing to drop this time...

It's none of my business, really. Just an
old habit...

When I was an active guard, I had to be
aware of everything that was going on.
It's a tough habit to break.
talk0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The soldiers are all restless and ready to
get back to the training regimen now that
the <clr:0000>training area<clr:ffff> is open again.
I understand though. The recent events
were pretty rough on everyone, and they
want to be ready for what comes next.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>If I wasn't retired, I'd be right there with
them. "In the vanguard," so to speak.
talk0032:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Unfortunately, it doesn't seem to have
helped against those <clr:0000>Gibdo<clr:ffff> things.
talk0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The <clr:0000>Gibdos<clr:ffff> are strange monsters.


Our spears didn't even scratch them when
the guards tried to fight.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I can't think of a time where monsters as
ferocious as these prowled the desert...

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Even with the new training regimen the
troops went through, these monsters are
too tough.
Brute force won't help much if you run
into them. Be clever. Better yet, <clr:0000>think up
some kind of new weapon to fight them<clr:ffff>.
talk0033:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hey... Isn't Kara Kara Bazaar in trouble
right now? Were you planning on heading
there, by chance?
talk0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Are you planning to go? I ask because I'm
tired of caring for the injured, so...

Be careful.
talk0035:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you want, you could go chat with
Sudrey. She should be up at the barracks,
I believe.
talk0023:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>In case you're wondering, the soldiers all
went to face the <clr:0000>Gibdos<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c00>Despite them being elite soldiers who
completed the <clr:0000>new training regimen<clr:ffff>...
some still aren't healed from the last fight.
<sp:3:0:2:0000>I'd have jumped in if I were still on active
duty, but all I can do nowadays is wait
and pray for their safe return...
talk0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I understand that you are free to make
use of whatever you find around here.

If you get hungry, you can use the
cooking pot to prepare something.
talk0036:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you're interested in checking it out,
it's located <clr:0000>south<clr:ffff> of town.

Be aware though... It's right in the middle
of the harsh desert, so make sure you're
prepared before you head out there.
talk0000:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Not even the <clr:0000>new training regimen <clr:ffff>could
prepare our noble guards for all the
recent events...
What's going to happen the next time
those <clr:0000>Gibdo<clr:ffff> things show up?
talk0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad>...<sp:0:4:0>Sav'saaba...<sp:5:0:0> What do you need from me at
this hour?
